title: INfinance
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: ‘I feel overwhelmed’: I’m a widow in my early 40s with 3 children. I have $330K in IRAs. Will be OK?
My former mother-in-law left a $1 million estate. Can I sue my ex-husband for a share of it?
items.description: “My mother-in-law did not leave me anything in her will, but she should have.”

items.title: The small-business hiring engine is sputtering. Why that’s a red flag for the economy.
items.description: Without small businesses and their hiring, already precarious economic growth could be prone to a pullback.

items.title: ‘I thought she was honest’: My ex-wife hid stocks during our divorce. Can I sue her?
items.description: “I have contacted her about it, but she refuses to answer my calls.”

items.title: I inherited $600K in Apple stock. It now makes up 50% of my portfolio. Is that too risky?
items.description: “I worry that a downturn in the tech sector, or something Apple-specific, could wipe out half my portfolio.”

items.title: Comex Gold, Silver Settle Lower
items.description: Gold settled 1.4% lower, down two of the past three sessions, and silver fell 2.5%, down three of the past four sessions.

items.title: Arabica Coffee Prices Hit Record on U.S., Colombia Tariff Spat

items.title: Financial Services Roundup: Market Talk
items.description: Gain insight on Experian, SoFi Technologies and more in the latest Market Talks covering Financial Services.

items.title: Stocks Sink in Broad AI Rout Sparked by China's DeepSeek

items.title: DeepSeek Won't Sink U.S. AI Titans
items.description: Panic fueling the selloff of Nvidia, Broadcom and other tech giants is overblown.
